title: High Gross Savings Rate
description: In 2023, Indonesia achieved a gross savings rate of 7,510,595,299,407,600 LCU, indicating a strong capacity for future investments and economic stability.

title: Significant Manufacturing Sector
description: Indonesia's manufacturing sector added a value of 2,507,799,800,000,000 LCU in 2023, showcasing its industrial strength and contribution to the economy.

title: Efficient Utility Services
description: In 2024, Indonesia scored 98.96 in operational efficiency of utility service provision, reflecting high standards in utility management.

title: High Prevalence of Tobacco Use Among Males
description: In 2022, 73.1% of male adults in Indonesia were current tobacco users, indicating a significant public health challenge.

title: Low Percentage of Trained Preprimary Teachers
description: In 2023, only 3.22% of preprimary teachers in Indonesia were trained, highlighting a critical area for educational development.

title: Negative Net Primary Income
description: In 2023, Indonesia experienced a net primary income of -537,935,133,823,997 LCU, indicating more income was paid abroad than received.

title: High Carbon Dioxide Emissions from LULUCF
description: In 2022, Indonesia's CO2 net fluxes from land use, land-use change, and forestry were 924.85 Mt CO2e, contributing significantly to global emissions.
